title: Who Is Mitesh Khapra? TIME Magazine Lists IIT Madras Professor Among Top 100 AI Leaders
description: TIME Magazine has named IIT Madras professor Mitesh Khapra among the 100 most influential people in AI for 2025. Khapra, co-founder of AI4Bharat, focuses on creating open-source tools and datasets for Indian languages. His recognition highlights the growing global impact of India’s academic research in artificial intelligence.
content: Indian academia has scored a big win in the global tech space. Mitesh Khapra, Associate Professor at IIT Madras, has been named among TIME Magazine’s 2025 list of the 100 most influential people in AI, a roster usually dominated by corporate giants l... [1366 chars]

title: Teachers’ Day 2025: Will AI disrupt teaching jobs?
description: Teachers’ Day 2025: India is marking Teachers’ Day and commemorating the birth anniversary of Dr Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan, a renowned academic and philosopher, today (September 5). The advancement in artificial intelligence (AI) has led to valid questions about whether it could replace teachers in the future. Experts are not so concerned. Here’s why
content:
Today (September 5) is the day to celebrate our teachers. India marks this date every year as Teachers’ Day to commemorate the birth anniversary of Dr Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan, a renowned academic and philosopher and the country’s second President.
A... [6513 chars]

title: Can courts safeguard fairness in an AI age?
description: In the criminal justice system, decisions about when and how long to detain people have historically been made by other people, like judges and parole boards. But that process is changing: Decision-makers increasingly include artificial intelligence systems in a variety of tasks, from predicting crime to analyzing DNA to recommending prison sentences.

title: From Bill Gates to Mark Zuckerberg, Donald Trump dines with AI and tech leaders - In pics
description: US President Donald Trump hosted a high-level group of tech leaders at the White House on Thursday, September 4, 2025, exhibiting artificial intelligence research and talking about investments being made by American companies. The dinner was planned to be held in the White House’s Rose Garden, which was recently redecorated to set up tables, chairs, and umbrellas. However, due to bad weather, officials shifted it to the State Dining Room instead.

title: India Leads with Innovation as AcademIQ.io Brings AI to Every Classroom
description: New Delhi [India], September 5: In 2025, artificial intelligence is no longer confined to labs and tech firms. It's making its way into real classrooms--transforming everything from how lessons are prepared to how students learn. From high-performing institutions in Europe to government schools in rural India, AI-powered learning platforms are quietly redefining modern education.

title: FT: OpenAI to make custom AI chips with Broadcom next year
description: OpenAI is partnering with Broadcom to manufacture its own artificial intelligence chips set for shipping in 2026.
content:
Sam Altman said that OpenAI would use ‘well over 1m GPUs’ by the end of 2025.
OpenAI has tapped chipmaker Broadcom to mass manufacture its own artificial intelligence chips set for shipping in 2026, the Financial Times has reported.

title: From Algorithms to Altars | How AI and SEO Are Transforming the Wedding Industry
description: The wedding industry might seem like the last place technology would dominate. After all, vows, venues, and champagne toasts feel a world away from algorithms and analytics. title: US AI giant Anthropic bars Chinese-owned entities
description: Anthropic is barring Chinese-run companies and organisations from using its artificial intelligence services, the US tech giant said, as it toughened restrictions on "authoritarian regions."
content:

title: Civil servants refuse to use AI because of net zero concerns
description: Findings cast doubt on Labour’s plans to use artificial intelligence for Whitehall restructure
content:
A report found that civil servants are reluctant to use AI due to environmental concerns, casting doubt on Sir Keir Starmer’s plans to restructure Whitehall with it.
